Description: Shallow marl pottery bowl with flat base and wide flaring sides, with sharply in-turned rim; coated with orange slip and loosely burnished radially on the interior and burnished horizontally on the exterior around the upper body only.
Curator's comments: Marked H65 on the base. Late ware L3 in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921), see also W.M.F Petrie and A.C. Mace, Diospolis Parva, London (1901), pl. xviii.3.
